metrics.name: semantic_fidelity
metrics.description: How well the output preserves the semantic meaning and intent of the input
metrics.guidelines:
Score 1: Completely unfaithful - Output contradicts or has no relation to the input
Score 2: Mostly unfaithful - Major semantic deviations or omissions
Score 3: Partially faithful - Some key information preserved but with notable gaps
Score 4: Mostly faithful - Minor deviations but core semantics preserved
Score 5: Completely faithful - Perfect preservation of semantic meaning and intent

metrics.name: decomposition_quality
metrics.description: How effectively the output breaks down complex concepts into clear, logical components
metrics.guidelines:
Score 1: Poor decomposition - Concepts remain tangled or unclear
Score 2: Weak decomposition - Some structure but still confusing
Score 3: Adequate decomposition - Basic logical breakdown present
Score 4: Good decomposition - Clear logical structure with minor issues
Score 5: Excellent decomposition - Perfectly organized, clear hierarchy and flow

metrics.name: constraint_adherence
metrics.description: How well the output respects and follows constraints specified in the input
metrics.guidelines:
Score 1: No adherence - Multiple constraints violated or ignored
Score 2: Poor adherence - Several constraints violated
Score 3: Moderate adherence - Some constraints followed, some violated
Score 4: Good adherence - Most constraints followed with minor violations
Score 5: Perfect adherence - All constraints strictly followed

flags.name: invented_constraints
flags.description: Output introduces constraints or requirements not present in the input

flags.name: omitted_constraints
flags.description: Output fails to address constraints explicitly stated in the input
